name: Sunlit Watertank
description:
Hi, you are viewing an original oil painting "Sunlit Watertank" done on a linen panel. This 2013 unframed painting is 8x10" signed, titled, and dated
This painting is a view of a sunlit water tank in the New Center area of Detroit
I have been painting for over 30 years. I have had more than 25 solo shows and numerous group shows. I currently show with the George Billis Gallery in NY and with the David Klein Gallery in Birmingham MI.
My work is in over twenty-five corporate and museum collections and in hundreds of private collections.
I live and work with my artist wife, Janet Hamrick and our two studio cats, Artie and Bella, in Ferndale, Michigan. We also have been subletting a painting loft in New York City for more than 10 years.

name: Shadows & Tags
description:
Hi my name is Stephen Magsig and you are viewing
my original Drypoint print on Rives heavyweight Paper, image 8x6" on 12x9" Paper" signed, titled and dated. 2012
Edition of 9 and 3 AP
This print is a view of shadows and tags on a RR Bridge in Detroit. Print #6/9 from a copper plate and Faust warm black ink hand pulled by me. Each print is slightly different, this is the actual image and has a very rich plate tone. I have tried to make this image as close to the print as possible.

name: Belle Isle Foot Bridge II
description:
An Original Monotype
Image size - 6x4.5" plate
This is an original, one of a kind monotype print of a Belle Isle footbridge over Nashua Creek with reflections and water lilies. It is printed with Kelsey black oil based ink on white Rives heavyweight paper.

This monotype print was made by inking a zinc plate with a roller, then removing and drawing into the ink to leave a design. Damp paper is then place on the plate and this is put through the press. The ink is transferred from the plate to the paper, so only one print can be made.  

This is the reworked print from the first monotype print. The plate has more ink added and again is reworked to create the second original print. The mid-tone values in this one are lighter than the first print.

This print is presented in a board backed clear protective sleeve and packed carefully with extra card for strength.

It is unmounted and unframed. It is numbered 1/1 signed and dated

categories.name: ORIGINAL PRINTS BY J HAMRICK & S MAGSIG

name: Belle Isle Foot Bridge
description:
An Original Monotype
Image size - 6x4.5" plate
This is an original, one of a kind monotype print of a Belle Isle footbridge over Nashua Creek with reflections and water lilies. It is printed with Kelsey black oil based ink on white Rives heavyweight paper.

This monotype print was made by inking a zinc plate with a roller, then removing and drawing into the ink to leave a design. Damp paper is then place on the plate and this is put through the press. The ink is transferred from the plate to the paper, so only one print can be made. There is a ghost image left on the plate. I used this ghost image as a base for a second similar but original monotype print

This print is presented in a board backed clear protective sleeve and packed carefully with extra card for strength.

It is unmounted and unframed. It is numbered 1/1 signed and dated

name: MICHIGAN II

An Original Monotype
Image size - 6x4.5" plate
This is an original, one of a kind monotype print of an abandoned building on Jefferson Ave in Delray along the Detroit river. It is printed with Kelsey black oil based ink on white Rives paper.

This monotype print was made by inking a zinc plate with a roller, then removing and drawing into the ink to leave a design. Damp paper is then place on the plate and this is put through the press. The ink is transferred from the plate to the paper, so only one print can be made. There is a ghost image left on the plate. This is the second monotype re-worked from the ghost image from the first print.
This print is presented in a board backed clear protective sleeve and packed carefully with extra card for strength.

It is unmounted and unframed. It is numbered 1/1 signed and dated

This is the second monotype re-worked from the ghost image from the first print.

Done in homage to Joseph Cornell.
The box is approx 11"x6 1/2" x 1 5/8" Signed titled and dated.

name: Salt Mine
description:
Linocut, 2012, 6 color 7x5" on 11x8.5 paper.Edition of 20 and 3 Artist proofs. without frame or mat

 A six color reduction linocut print of the Detroit Salt Mine.

In a reduction print the artist develops all colors from the same block. For each color pass the artist removes more material from the block. Each color is printed on top of the previous. The artist must print the entire edition as he or she works, because the printable area of the single block is reduced with each pass.

The buyer will receive the painting safely packaged and ready to frame or hang as is. This painting s a view of the stage door of the Hilberry Theatre on Cass Ave  in Detroit, MI. I was very inspired  after seeing the wonderful print show Silent Watch  at Wayne State University  of Finnish print makers. name: Manhattan Bridge
description:
Original monotype
Image size - 12 x 9" 
This is an original, one of a kind monotype print of Manhattan Bridge. It is printed with Faust black oil based ink on white Rives paper.

My monotype prints are made by inking a plexiglass plate with a roller, then drawing into it and wiping off some of the ink to leave a design. Damp paper is then place on the plate and this is put through the press. The ink is transferred from the plate to the paper, so only one print can be made.

This print is presented in a board backed clear protective sleeve and packed carefully in a padded envelope with extra card for strength. 

It is unmounted and unframed. It is numbered 1/1 and initialled on the front, and signed and dated on the back.

categories.name: ORIGINAL PRINTS BY J HAMRICK & S MAGSIG

name: Neon "a"
description:
Reduction linocut, 2011, 11 colors, 9"x9", edition of 8 unframed

Relief block printing from a single block. 1 st stage is the white of the paper, inking the block with the first color and running it through the press. Carve away for the next color and print until you are done. Also known as the "suicide method" because once you begin you can not go back.

description:
An Original, Signed, Oil Painting on Oil Primed Linen Panel
This painting is an urban landscape of sunlight and shadows on a building on 8 mile Road . in Detroit.
The 2011 painting is 5x7"signed and dated and is self hanging

Stephen Magsig lives and paints in Ferndale, Michigan.
He has been painting for over 30 years, and has been in more than 25 solo shows and numerous group shows.
His work is in more than 20 corporate and museum collections, and in hundreds of private collections, around the World.

description:
Softcover, 6.5x6.5" 2008, 36 pages

The Urban Alphabet book contains images of small paintings by the American Artist Stephen Magsig from details of old theater marquees, neon signs and painted signs of local businesses. They are a record of a vanishing landscape. Most are derived from photos of the Detroit vernacular scene. With this alphabet Stephen Magsig examines a bit of Detroit’s past and shows a bit of his own.

name: Belle Isle Paintings
description:
This art book contains 61 images of small paintings of Belle Isle Park by American Artist Stephen Magsig. Belle Isle Park is a part of the city of Detroit and is one of the nation's largest island parks. The images were painted from 2007-2011 and cover all the seasons. The images were first posted on the artblog: Postcards from Detroit. 72 pages with 61 painting images.

With an introduction by Bill Zeising and Susan Macdonald.

Book is standard landscape, Approx. 8x10" 
Available in hardcover with dust jacket and softcover.

name: Postcards from Detroit, Vol I
description:
This art book contains over 100 images of small paintings of Detroit  posted on the blog: "Postcards from Detroit" in 2007, by American Artist Stephen Magsig.

 Postcards from Detroit is a visual diary of Detroit in paintings. Stephen started painting Detroit 25 years ago, and continues to find inspiration in the place he calls home. 

With an introduction by Mark Livengood, Madison, Wisconsin

Book is standard landscape, 80 pages approx. 8x10"
Available in hardcover with dust jacket and softcover.

name: Postcards from Detroit, Vol II
description:
This volume is 120 pages with over 200 paintings from 2008, posted on the blog: "Postcards from Detroit" by American Artist Stephen Magsig

With an introduction by George Tysh, Ferndale, MI

Book is standard landscape, 120 pages approx. 8x10"
Available in hardcover with dust jacket and softcover.

Postcards from Detroit is a visual diary of Detroit in paintings. Stephen started painting Detroit 25 years ago, and continues to find inspiration in the place he calls home.

name: Miss Genevieve #004
description:
Original fine art Postcard, mixed media collage. This collage is a vintage postcard, rubber stamp, vintage stamps, torn and cut paper, and misc found items.

Collage size is 3 1/2 x 5 1/2" mounted on 5x7" archival stock.

This is the forth in the Genevieve series. I received a large batch of "postcards to Genevieve" from a dear collector friend of mine. I would like to do 100 of these and compile them into a book, "Postcards to Genevieve" once they are done.
